results.title: She Bought the House Her Mother Cleaned for 43 Years
results.abstract: Nichol Naranjo says she was destined to own the house that was a refuge, “a place to come and catch our breath. And to dream.”

media.caption: Margaret Gaxiola, left, was once the housekeeper of the home that her daughter Nichol Naranjo, right, bought in 2020.
media.copyright: John Burcham for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Cooking and Cookbooks;Writing and Writers;Books and Literature;Movies;Blogs and Blogging (Internet);Powell, Julie;Child, Julia
results.byline: By Kim Severson and Julia Moskin
results.title: Julie Powell, Food Writer Known for ‘Julie & Julia,’ Dies at 49
results.abstract: She attempted to cook every recipe in a classic Julia Child cookbook and documented the effort in a popular blog that became a best-selling book and a hit movie.

media.caption: Julie Powell in 2009, the year Nora Ephron's movie “Julie & Julia,” based on Ms. Powell’s book, was released.
media.copyright: Kelly Campbell, via Little, Brown & Company

results.adx_keywords: Television;Applegate, Christina
results.title: Christina Applegate Pours One Out for ‘Dead to Me’
results.abstract: Diagnosed with multiple sclerosis during filming of the show’s final season, Applegate was determined to finish the story. She said it was the hardest thing she’s ever done.

media.caption: Christina Applegate in the final season of “Dead to Me,” premiering Nov. 17 on Netflix. “This is the first time anyone’s going to see me the way I am,” she said.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Labor and Jobs;Computers and the Internet;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.title: Elon Musk Begins Layoffs at Twitter
results.abstract: The social media company’s 7,500 employees have been bracing for job cuts since Mr. Musk took it over last week.

media.caption: Twitter’s headquarters in San Francisco. About half the company’s 7,500 workers appeared set to lose their jobs.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;James, Letitia;Epshteyn, Boris;Trump Organization;Palm Beach (Fla)
results.byline: By Jonah E. Bromwich, Maggie Haberman, Ben Protess and William K. Rashbaum
results.title: Trump Files a Suit Against N.Y.’s Attorney General, and Against Advice
results.abstract: The case, filed in Florida, seeks to stop Letitia James’s lawsuit in New York and includes Mr. Trump’s signature rhetoric. His legal advisers are split on the wisdom of filing it.

media.caption: The Florida suit includes boasts about the former president’s business and insults directed at his opponents.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Social Security (US);Medicare;Retirement;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Democratic Party;Republican Party;House of Representatives;Senate
results.title: Republicans, Eyeing Majority, Float Changes to Social Security and Medicare
results.abstract: Democrats have seized on Republican proposals to limit retirement benefits to galvanize voters ahead of the midterm elections.

media.caption: Senator Rick Scott, Republican of Florida, has proposed subjecting nearly all federal spending programs to a renewal vote every year, which would make Medicare and Social Security more vulnerable to budget cuts.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: Imran Khan, Ex-Prime Minister of Pakistan, Is Shot at Rally
results.abstract: Mr. Khan, who was leading a protest march, was wounded in both legs, in an attack that threated to plunge the country into turmoil.

results.title: Nets Suspend Kyrie Irving Indefinitely After Antisemitic Movie Post

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;World Series;Javier, Cristian (1997- );Nola, Aaron (1993- );Montero, Rafael;Abreu, Bryan (1997- );Houston Astros;Philadelphia Phillies
results.title: Astros Combine for Second No-Hitter in World Series History
results.abstract: Cristian Javier and three relievers shut down the powerful Philadelphia Phillies, tying the World Series and accomplishing a feat that hadn’t happened since 1956.

media.caption: Houston’s Cristian Javier was dominant for six innings. He struck out nine, issued two walks and did not allow a hit. Three relievers finished off the first World Series no-hitter since Don Larsen’s perfect game for the Yankees in 1956.

media.caption: Elon Musk in January 2020. As Twitter’s new owner, he met this week with civil rights groups.

results.title: Who Wears Crop Tops to the Office?
results.abstract: Young employees, many of them new to office jobs, are bringing a wardrobe staple usually reserved for the weekends into the workplace.

media.caption: Santina Rizzi in the Miami plastic surgery office where she works as a social media manager. “I’m not going to buy clothes specifically for my job,” she said of her fondness for wearing crop tops to work.

results.title: Elon Musk, Under Financial Pressure, Pushes to Make Money From Twitter

results.title: Parkland Gunman Gets 34 Life Sentences
results.abstract: The gunman who killed 17 people at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School was addressed directly by the families of his victims for the first time.

media.caption: Linda Beigel Schulman displayed a composite photo of the 17 murdered students and staff as she gave her victim impact statement on Wednesday. Her son, Scott Beigel, was killed in the 2018 mass shooting.

results.title: Suspect in Pelosi Attack Was in the U.S. Illegally, Officials Say
results.abstract: David DePape, a Canadian, legally entered the United States in 2008. He faces several state and federal charges after the authorities say he broke into Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home and assaulted her husband.

media.caption: Police officers outside Speaker Nancy Pelosi’s home in San Francisco last week.

results.title: Who Is Jennifer Lawrence Now?
results.abstract: The Oscar-winning “Hunger Games” actress is free from her franchise commitments. But after a brief hiatus from acting, what will she do next?

media.caption: “I obviously cannot relate to risking my life for my country,” Jennifer Lawrence said, “but I can understand, reading ‘Causeway,’ why I’m getting so emotional about somebody who doesn’t feel like they belong anywhere unless they’re on a schedule.”
media.copyright: Robbie Lawrence for The New York Times

results.title: Lapid Concedes in Israel, Paving Way for Netanyahu’s Return to Power
results.abstract: After five elections in less than four years, Israel will have a stable government for the first time since 2019. But Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition could test the constitutional framework and social fabric.

media.caption: Benjamin Netanyahu in Jerusalem on Tuesday. His return to power could strain some of his country’s diplomatic relations, notably with the United States and with Arab states.
media.copyright: Amit Elkayam for The New York Times
